definition: Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi

sentences.english: Wang An Shi drive this question not ask of ask a sentence to the lane of but not angry at all.
sentences.chinese: 王安石被這答非所問的問句給弄的卻一點都不生氣。

sentences.english: The fifth part analyses the impact of Wang Anshi's personality characteristics over the political reform' success and failure.
sentences.chinese: 第五部分分析了王安石的個性特徵對變法成敗的影響。

sentences.english: During North Song Dynasty, the school of WANG An-shi formed a strong groups researching on Zhuangzi.
sentences.chinese: 王安石學派是莊學史上特有的治《莊》羣體。

sentences.english: There are few works of Ci (a Chinese poetic genre) left by Wang Anshi, but most of them are related with Zen.
sentences.chinese: 王安石現存的詞作不多，但絕大多數都與佛禪有關。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi's theory of "New Learning" served as his theoretical basis in introducing the "New Laws".
sentences.chinese: “荊公新學”是王安石變法的理論基礎。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi is a famous reformer in the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 王安石是北宋著名的改革家。

sentences.english: To value classics and degrade historical documents is one distinguishing feature of Wang An-shi's ideas.
sentences.chinese: 尊經卑史是王安石學術思想的一個重要特點。

sentences.english: Wang Anshi is an important poet in the region of poetry in the middle period of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 王安石是北宋中期詩壇上一位重要詩人。

sentences.english: Be listened by Wang An Shi, nowise show consideration of give her head a record.
sentences.chinese: 被王安石聽到了，毫不留情的就給了她腦袋一記。

definition: Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
failed reform of Northern Song government in 1043
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Kou Zhun (961-1023), Northern Song politician and poet
Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure
Su Xun (1009-1066), Northern Song writer of prose, one of the Three Su 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of Eight Giants 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Zeng Gong (1019-1083), Song dynasty writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
to change the laws/political reform/unconventional method
Liu Yuxi (772-842), Tang poet
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
